intro: Hieracium furvellum, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, pastures, and disturbed soils, preferring full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are bright yellow with a central disk. Hieracium furvellum is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and can form dense colonies in suitable habitats.
